word_mean: 蕈，蘑菇：担子菌的子实体，如伞菌目(Agaricales)的肉质真菌，可食用。其有毒种类通称毒蕈(toadstools)。另见agaric项下

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (originally denoting any fungus having a fleshy fruiting body): from Old French mousseron, from late Latin mussirio(n-)

entry.def: Mushrooms are fungi that you can eat.

example.ex: There are many types of wild mushrooms.

entry.def: If something such as an industry or a place mushrooms, it grows or comes into existence very quickly.

example.ex: The media training industry has mushroomed over the past decade...
example.tran: 在过去10年里，媒体培训产业迅速成长。

example.ex: A sleepy capital of a few hundred thousand people has mushroomed to a crowded city of 2 million.
example.tran: 几十万人的沉寂首府迅速发展成为拥有两百万人口的拥挤都市。

means.word_mean: 1. common name for an edible agaric (contrasting with the inedible toadstool)
2. any of various fleshy fungi of the subdivision Basidiomycota consisting of a cap at the end of a stem arising from an underground mycelium
3. a large cloud of rubble and dust shaped like a mushroom and rising into the sky after an explosion (especially of a nuclear bomb)
4. fleshy body of any of numerous edible fungi

sentences.en: Some mushrooms are good to eat; some are poisonous.
sentences.cn: 有些蘑菇可食用, 有些则有毒。

means.word_mean: 如蘑菇般生长迅速的事物

sentences.cn: 伯明翰是个迅猛发展的城市。

sentences.en: The mushroom development of technology will pave the way for improving our economy.
sentences.cn: 科学技术的迅猛发展将为我们改善经济状况铺平道路。

means.word_mean: 迅速成长[发展],快速生长；迅速增长

sentences.en: New housing estates have mushroomed on the edge of the town.
sentences.cn: 城郊的新住宅楼发展得十分迅速。

sentences.en: The little town mushroomed into a city.
sentences.cn: 那座小镇迅速发展成一座城市。

sentences.en: The smoke mushroomed into the sky.
